intro: Hymenoxys ambigens var. neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico hymenoxys, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
